s.text: Don't you think everyone would feel better if there were an agency that could actually step forward and say, "We are now officially in a correction," the way the government does with recessions?
A Federal Reserve rate hike on Nov. 16 is now a foregone conclusion, and there may already be a rate hike after that one priced into the market.
A Federal Reserve rate hike on Nov. 16 is now a foregone conclusion, and there may already be a rate hike after that one priced into the market.
Well, in this brave new world, if you have a screen name, you're fair game."

Regardless, the market did take it on the chin this week, battered by the combination of earnings disappointments from a couple of bellwethers and, above all, by the soaring yield on the 30-year bond.
